mobs.long_desc: A soldier with long moustaches keeps watch on the valley below.
mobs.desc: This yellow-skinned orc has a glowering look on his face.  He is dressed warmly and is fairly thin, for an orc.  His moustaches hang down below his chin, and scars are visible on the backs of his hands.

mobs.long_desc: An orc sergeant supervises the area.
mobs.desc: Only a little larger than the soldiers in his command, this sergeant exhibits a small but detectable attitude of superiority.  He glares about from beneath bushy eyebrows, on high alert to any threat to his authority.

mobs.long_desc: An unarmored soldier moves quickly along the path.
mobs.desc: This thin orc bears himself like a soldier, but carries no armor: perhaps the clawed foot on his jerkin identifies him as a runner, carrying messages. Bandages on his neck are stained from ichor seeping up from beneath.

mobs.long_desc: A proud dark brown eagle soars above the rocks.
mobs.desc: Dark brown feathers, some fading to an almost golden color, cover this proud raptor from head to tail.  Its underside is covered with light gray feathers. Its strong beak and cruel talons are ideal for capturing small, innocent rodents and shredding them.

mobs.long_desc: A small furry pika scurries from crack to crack.
mobs.desc: This small rodentlike creature makes its living in high elevations.  The safety it gains from landbound predators is offset by the toll of the raptors, who feed easily while it scurries for a place to hide.  It dines on sparse grasses.

mobs.long_desc: A big-eared cat with spots and stripes hunts among the crags.
mobs.desc: Smaller than a leopard, these large spotted cats are excellent hunters.  They are rarely seen by day, and with their huge ears they find pikas with frightening ease.  The rippling of their lean muscles accentuates their beautiful coats.

mobs.long_desc: A large greenish parrot with a hooked bill walks among the rocks.
mobs.desc: The kea has a comical look even when it isn't clowning around, with its big black eyes and stocky green body.  Its beak, however, isn't so funny.  It looks like just the thing to savage small animals, which is just what keas do.

mobs.long_desc: A morose skeleton wearing rusted armor stands here motionless.
mobs.desc: This skeleton doesn't look too old, for bits of skin and scalp still cling in dried patches to its bleaching bone.  The rusted bits of armor that still hang from its shoulders are clearly not of orc manufacture - in fact, they resemble what the nearby paladins wear.

mobs.long_desc: A soldier stands watch over the valley to the east.
mobs.desc: This appears to be a foot soldier clad in mostly leather and iron armor.  He has a few scars, and his equipment has seen some damage but is well-repaired. There is some impatience in his posture, but he remains vigilant.

mobs.long_desc: A paladin watches over the fire.
mobs.desc: The insignia of Sacred Haven are clearly marked on the armor of this holy warrior.  The burnished surface of his immaculate armor peeks out from under a cloth overcoat that no doubt disguises its bright reflection.  He has a resolute look on his proud face, and a calm demeanor.

mobs.long_desc: A soldier in messenger's livery moves quickly along.
mobs.desc: This young soldier seems a bit inexperienced.  He consults a scrap of paper frequently, and changes direction from time to time.  He looks flustered and in a hurry.  Only the lightest of armor covers his shoulders and torso, and no scars are visible on his light skin.

mobs.long_desc: A small gray crab sits here looking just like a rock.
mobs.desc: This little crustacean looks just like a rock.  Its medium gray color blends perfectly with the scree and surrounding rocky hillsides.  Its claws are somewhat oversize, and look extremely dangerous.

mobs.long_desc: A sturdy mountain goat with curving horns stands on an outcrop.
mobs.desc: The white coat of this lean beast does little to camouflage it, at least during the summer, but it has little to fear from predators.  None near its size will scale the cliffs that it prances up with ease.  A large pair of curving horns identifies this one as a ram.

mobs.long_desc: A slender figure in a hooded cloak stands nearby in silence.
mobs.desc: On closer inspection, this figure is revealed to be a half-elf woman.  She is dressed the color of shaded rock, and nearly impossible to see when motionless. Her light gray eyes are only marginally brighter than the hillside, and resemble the sky before a storm.

mobs.keywords: troll snow-troll small white furry humanoid
mobs.long_desc: A small white furry humanoid with long teeth peers out of the snow.
mobs.desc: A matted white coat covers this odd little creature, who resembles a tiny, ugly gorilla.  Its dark gray skin is visible on its face, hands, and feet.  Sharp ugly teeth jut out from its jaws at odd angles.  Is that a trace of blood on its muzzle?

mobs.keywords: murgbol priestess orc diabolist priest woman diabolical
mobs.long_desc: A diabolical orc priestess stands here, her eyes fixed on the horizon.
mobs.desc: Murgbol surveys the landscape from Ogakh to Bluebonnet Pass with steely determination.  She wears a coat of crimson decorated with the symbols of the Orcish pantheon over grey leather armor.  The signs of Gruumsh, a square superimposed on a cat's eye, and the Nine Hells stand out prominently. However, around her neck she wears several different holy symbols, including the seven-star circle of Mystra, goddess of magic.

objects.ground: A mouldering skeleton lies crumbling among the rocks.

extras.text: Rotten leather and rusting bits of metal lie on and under this decaying heap of bones. It is in fairly good shape for a skeleton, and cannot have lain here for more than a few years. Black mould grows in blotches all over.

objects.ground: A small, broken leather strap lies here.

extras.text: It's a short length of leather, broken at one end, and crumbling with age. There are a few small holes at the unbroken end, suggesting that it may once have been a strap, perhaps part of a piece of armor.

objects.ground: A sliver of steel pokes up from a crack in the rock.

extras.text: This is a splinter of steel in an elongated triangle.  The long edge is sharp, though it might be handled with some care.  Embossed decoration and the peculiar way the metal curves away from the edge seem reminiscent of the fine longswords sometimes worn by the paladins of Sacred Haven.

objects.short: the badge of the severed claw
objects.ground: An orange badge with a black claw lies on the ground.

extras.text: This is a triangular iron badge, whose front has been painted bright orange. In the middle of the orange field is a claw, perhaps of a large reptile, severed two-thirds of the way from the tip, and painted black.

objects.ground: A small dark sword lies forgotten in the dirt.

extras.text: This small sword appears to be made from iron and other base metals. It has a nasty edge and a crude grip, and appears to be only a little more effective than a plain iron blade.

objects.ground: Leather sleeves with black stains lie on the ground.

extras.text: These sleeves are made of thick, hard layers of leather. It appears to have been boiled, then cured with chemicals. There are splotches of uneven black stains, though whether they are a result of the curing process or later damage is unclear.

objects.ground: A pair of stained leather boots stands off to one side.

extras.text: These boots are made of lightweight brown leather.  Reinforcement around the toe and heel provides some protection, but they are better at enhancing agility than stopping sword-blows.

objects.ground: A piece of crinkled white parchment has been discarded here.

extras.text: The parchment has a short message, which appears to be written in orcish.  On closer examination, however, it is revealed to be in some sort of military code, which you cannot decipher.

objects.ground: A small, reddish-colored leather bag is nearly covered by dust.

extras.text: This little bag seems to be carrying something small and heavy, like stones or chunks of metal. It is slightly warm to the touch. It is tightly tied shut with sinew.

objects.ground: A slightly curved longsword lies here.

extras.text: This appears to be a quality weapon.  The work of a Soltan forge is evident in its slightly curved blade and fattened handle.  It shows moderate wear and has two very sharp edges.

objects.ground: A black leather scroll lies here rolled up.

extras.text: Nothing but a dull black color stares out from the surface of this thin leather scroll. It is clearly meant to be written on, but where is the writing?

objects.ground: A signet ring with a tiny emerald lies here forgotten.

extras.text: This ring has a fairly large flat surface, on which is embossed the figure of a swordfish, leaping.  The detail is precise.  The tiniest of emeralds sits in the eye of the fish.

objects.ground: A vial containing a translucent red liquid lies on its side.

extras.text: The vial contains a viscous liquid, a dull red or brownish color, which is translucent.  Small bubbles hang in the middle of the liquid, which flows like cool treacle when the vial is tipped.

objects.ground: A short bronze sword sticks out of the ground.

extras.text: This little yellowish-brown sword is stained heavily, as if it were left out in the weather for some time.  However, its light weight and razor-sharp edge make it a useful weapon still.

objects.short: a rock with symbols on it
objects.ground: A rock lies here.  It looks interesting.

extras.text: It's just a little rock.  Except for all the symbols.  Those look verrry interesting.
The symbols look strange, probably because they were written by drunken trolls. One of them looks suspiciously like a trestle.
It's only a little scratched diagram of a trestle.  Next to it is a diagram of a wagon.
The wheels are missing.  How did you know it was a wagon!?
I SAID they were missing!

objects.ground: A beautiful eagle feather has been left on the ground here.

extras.text: The wing feather of the brown eagles that inhabit the Mountains of Pain, this feather is a pleasing golden color in the light.  It would make a fine quill to scribe spells with.

triggers.name: Druid spy moves once
triggers.commands: * Teleports the druid spy to a random location, once. Because I want it to be * in different places, but it can't be a wanderer, because that would make it * lose its hidden status. * Applied to: m30214 eval destination 30213 + %random.35% mteleport %self% %destination%

triggers.name: Sliding into the abyss
triggers.commands: * Makes players slide off the edge of a precipice, where they'll fall in a * ravine and get hurt. * Applied to: r30241, r30242 set victim %random.char% if %victim% == 0 || %victim.vnum% != -1 halt end set startroom %victim.room% * Don't bother flying or levitating people. if %victim.aff_flagged[FLY]% || %victim.aff_flagged[FEATHER_FALL]% halt end * Consider rangers and druids as too sure-footed to lose their footing. if %victim.class% == Ranger || %victim.class% == Druid wechoaround %victim% A rock shifts under %victim.name%'s foot, but %victim.n% quickly steps to one side. wsend %victim% A rock shifts under your foot, and you step to steadier ground. halt end wait 4 if %victim.room% != %startroom% halt end wechoaround %victim% %victim.name% slips on a loose rock, and begins to slide downward! wsend %victim% Your foot slips on a loose rock.  You are sliding downward! wait 3 s if %victim.room% != %startroom% halt end wechoaround %victim% %victim.name% is sliding straight toward a sheer dropoff! wsend %victim% You are sliding right toward a deep ravine! wait 2 s if %victim.room% != %startroom% halt end wechoaround %victim% %victim.name% disappears off the edge with a yelp! wsend %victim% You slide off the edge into thin air! wteleport %victim% 30255 wforce %victim% look

triggers.name: Sliding into the abyss II
triggers.commands: * Makes players slide off the edge of a precipice, where they'll fall into * a ravine and get hurt. * Applied to: r30229, r203217 set victim %random.char% if %victim% == 0 || %victim.vnum% != -1 halt end set startroom %victim.room% * Don't bother flying or levitating people. if %victim.aff_flagged[FLY]% || %victim.aff_flagged[FEATHER_FALL]% halt end * Consider rangers and druids as too sure-footed to lose their footing. if %victim.class% == Ranger || %victim.class% == Druid wechoaround %victim% A rock shifts under %victim.name%'s foot, but %victim.n% quickly steps to one side. wsend %victim% A rock shifts under your foot, and you step to steadier ground. halt end wait 4 if %victim.room% != %startroom% halt end wechoaround %victim% %victim.name% slips on a loose rock, and begins to slide downward! wsend %victim% Your foot slips on a loose rock.  You are sliding downward! wait 3 s if %victim.room% != %startroom% halt end wechoaround %victim% %victim.name% is sliding straight toward a sheer dropoff! wsend %victim% You are sliding right toward a deep ravine! wait 2 s if %victim.room% != %startroom% halt end wechoaround %victim% %victim.name% disappears off the edge with a yelp! wsend %victim% You slide off the edge into thin air! wteleport %victim% 30251 wforce %victim% look

triggers.name: A mild avalanche
triggers.commands: * Starts an avalanche. One player in the room is targeted, and will be * smacked by a rock and moved to a downhill room unless they escape. * Applied to: r30216, r30220, r30230, r30234, r30239, r30244 set victim %random.char% if %victim% == 0 || %victim.vnum% != -1 halt end set startroom %victim.room% wecho A quiet noise from above attracts your attention. wait 2 s wecho A few small pebbles and stones are falling down the hillside. wecho They clatter as they tumble. wait 2 s wecho Large rocks are tumbling past you!  They look heavy! wait 1 s if %self.vnum% == 30234 eval destroom %self.vnum% + 1 else eval destroom %self.vnum% - 1 end eval damage 80 + %random.50% if %victim.level% < 10 eval damage 3 + %random.5% elseif %victim.level% < 20 eval damage 10 + %random.8% elseif %victim.level% < 40 eval damage 30 + %random.30% end if %victim.room% == %startroom% if %victim.class% == Ranger wechoaround %victim% %victim.name% is nearly smacked by a large rock, but %victim.n% steps aside at the last moment. wsend %victim% A big rock comes hurtling toward you, but you step smoothly aside. else wdamage %victim% %damage% crush if %damdone% == 0 wechoaround %victim% The rocks seem to pass right through %victim.name%. wsend %victim% The rocks seem to pass right through you. else wechoaround %victim% A big rock hits %victim.name% right in the chest, and %victim.n% is knocked over! (&4%damdone%&0) wechoaround %victim% %victim.n% tumbles downhill! wsend %victim% You try to dodge the boulders, but a large stone whacks you in the chest! (&1%damdone%&0) wsend %victim% You are knocked down! wteleport %victim% %destroom% wechoaround %victim% %victim.name% tumbles down the trail from above, and comes to a rest. wait 1 s wforce %victim% look end end end wecho The remnants of the avalanche tumble past, and then silence returns to the mountains.

triggers.name: exploding bag
triggers.commands: * Makes the red leather bag explode when taken, hurting just the person who took it. * Applied to: o30209 return 0 oechoaround %actor% %actor.alias% reaches for %self.shortdesc%, but it suddenly &1&bexplodes!&0 osend %actor% As you reach for %self.shortdesc%, it suddenly &1&bexplodes!&0 eval damage %actor.level% * 3 + %random.19% odamage %actor% %damage% slash if %damdone% == 0 oechoaround %actor% Shards of metal fly right by %actor.name%! osend %actor% Shards of metal fly by!  Luckily, none of them hit you! else oechoaround %actor% Shards of metal hit %actor.alias% in the legs, causing serious wounds! (&1%damdone%&0) osend %actor% &1OUCH!&0  The shards cut your legs painfully! (&1%damdone%&0) end opurge %self%

triggers.name: Try to drag exploding bag: bang
triggers.commands: switch %cmd% case d return 0 halt done return 1 oechoaround %actor% %actor.alias% reaches for %self.shortdesc%, but it suddenly &1&bexplodes!&0 osend %actor% As you reach for %self.shortdesc%, it suddenly &1&bexplodes!&0 eval damage %actor.level% * 3 + %random.19% odamage %actor% %damage% slash if %damdone% == 0 oechoaround %actor% Shards of metal fly right by %actor.name%! osend %actor% Shards of metal fly by!  Luckily, none of them hit you! else oechoaround %actor% Shards of metal hit %actor.alias% in the legs, causing serious wounds! (&1%damdone%&0) osend %actor% OUCH!  The shards cut your legs painfully! (&1%damdone%&0) end opurge %self%

triggers.name: **UNUSED**
triggers.commands: * Allows normal use of 'd' command around red leather bag (it intercepts * the "drag" command in trigger 30206). * Applied to: o30209 return 0

triggers.name: Try to get rid of red bag, splode
triggers.commands: * Makes the red leather bag explode when you try to drop or give it. * Applied to: o30209 return 0 oechoaround %actor% %actor.alias% tries to let go of %self.shortdesc%, but it suddenly &1&bexplodes!&0 osend %actor% As you release %self.shortdesc%, it suddenly &1&bexplodes!&0 eval damage %actor.level% * 3 + %random.19% odamage %actor% %damage% slash if %damdone% == 0 oechoaround %actor% Shards of metal fly right by %actor.name%! osend %actor% Shards of metal fly by!  Luckily, none of them hit you! else oechoaround %actor% Shards of metal hit %actor.alias% in the legs, causing serious wounds! (&1%damdone%&0) osend %actor% OUCH!  The shards cut your legs painfully! (&1%damdone%&0) end opurge %self%

triggers.name: banish_murgbol_greet
triggers.commands: set stage %actor.quest_stage[banish]% wait 4 if %actor.class% /= priest || %actor.class% /= diabolist if %actor.quest_variable[banish:greet]% == 0 if %stage% == 0 say Wanna learn some spells kid? mecho mecho %self.name% says, 'I can teach you to hurl your enemies far into the outer planes mecho &0so they can never bother you again.' else if %stage% == 2 mecho %self.name% says, 'I can already tell you have made progress along your journey. mecho &0Let's keep going!' wait 1s emote closes her eyes and prays for further guidance. wait 3s say Yes, I see... emote nods.  'Quite challenging...' wait 1s emote opens her eyes. wait 2s say The gods wish to test your sway over the elemental forces. wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'Ice elementals wander deep in the frozen tunnels near the nest mecho &0of a mighty dragon.  Destroy the &6&bmost powerful of these elementals&0 to receive mecho &0your next vision, then return to me.' elseif %stage% == 3 mecho %self.name% says, 'It seems you've managed to destroy the ice elemental lord. mecho &0Let's press on!' wait 1s emote closes her eyes and prays for further guidance. wait 3s say Yes, most appropriate. wait 1s emote opens her eyes. wait 2s say The gods demand a sacrifice of life energy. wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'A powerful &5&btroll wizard&0 warps the tunnels of an ancient mine. mecho &0His blood will most please the gods.  After this is done, return to me.' elseif %stage% == 4 mecho %self.name% says, 'The gods are greatly pleased with your sacrifice. mecho &0Let's continue!' wait 1s emote closes her eyes and prays for further guidance. wait 3s say Naturally, such a thing must be done. wait 1s emote opens her eyes. wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'Since you've dispatched something living, it's time to banish mecho &0something lingering after death.' wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'In a room of art in an ancient burial site waits a &5long-dead&0 mecho &0&5apparition&0.  Its threads to this world are tenuous at best.  Send it to the mecho &0next world to receive the next part of the prayer.  Afterward, come back and mecho &0we shall continue.' elseif %stage% == 5 mecho %self.name% says, 'Your awareness continues to grow. mecho &0Let's keep moving!' wait 1s emote closes her eyes and prays for further guidance. wait 3s say Certainly, as you wish... wait 1s emote opens her eyes. wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'The gods of light will have you undertake the next step and mecho &0prove mastery over demonic energy.' wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'Far to the north in Frost Valley, there is a &9&bdemon corrupting&0 mecho &0&9&bthe world around it&0 through its very presence.  Exorcise it from Ethilien and mecho &0receive the reward of the gods, then return here.' elseif %stage% == 6 mecho %self.name% says, 'The gods of light are satisfied. mecho Let's see the final test!' wait 1s emote closes her eyes and prays for further guidance. wait 3s grin say Delightful choice. wait 1s emote opens her eyes. wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'Destroying celestial energy for the dark gods shall be your mecho &0final task.' wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'Many celestial beings have made their home in a floating mecho &0crystal fortress on South Caelia.  One in particular, a &7&bsix-winged seraph&0, mecho &0stands sentinel over the uppermost floors.  Banish it from Ethilien and the mecho &0gods will reward you with the final part of the prayer.  Return to me after, mecho &0and I shall help you perform it. elseif %stage% == 7 say I see you have been successful! wait 1s say Now, speak aloud the mystic word your visions revealed! endif quest variable banish %actor% greet 1 endif endif endif

triggers.name: banish_murgbol_speech1
triggers.argument_list: yes yes? sure yep okay yeah cool good
triggers.commands: wait 2 set stage %actor.quest_stage[banish]% if %actor.class% /= priest || %actor.class% /= diabolist if %stage% == 0 if %actor.level% > 64 say Good, good... quest start banish %actor.name% wait 1s say I shall see how the gods best wish me to teach you. mecho She closes her eyes and prays to the gods above and below. wait 7s say The gods have decreed you must go on a vision quest. wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'They demand you demonstrate power over the six animating forces. mecho &0After each demonstration, they'll provide you with a different part of the mecho &0spell to banish your foes.  &6&bRecord those visions&0 - they're critical to mecho &0unlocking the spell.' wait 7s mecho %self.name% says, 'Your first vision will be granted when you prove mastery over mecho &0magical life.  Find the &4mighty witch of the sea&0 in her lair beneath the waves mecho &0and defeat her.  The gods will give you part of the prayer.' wait 6s say Return to me after and I will guide you to your next act. wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'And if you need a reminder, check in with me on your &7&b[progress]&0 mecho &0any time you feel like it.' wait 2s say Now go! quest variable banish %actor% greet 1 else say Give it time kid.  You aren't ready to wield such power. endif endif endif

triggers.name: uaine_witch_death_banish
triggers.commands: set person %actor% set i %actor.group_size% if %i% unset person while %i% > 0 set person %actor.group_member[%i%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[banish]% == 1 quest advance banish %person.name% msend %person% &5&bA single letter pops into your mind - &6&bV&0 endif endif eval i %i% - 1 done elseif %person.quest_stage[banish]% == 1 quest advance banish %person.name% msend %person% &5&bA single letter pops into your mind - &6&bV&0 endif

triggers.name: ice_lord_death_banish
triggers.commands: set person %actor% set i %actor.group_size% if %i% unset person while %i% > 0 set person %actor.group_member[%i%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[banish]% == 2 quest advance banish %person.name% msend %person% &5&bA single letter pops into your mind - &6&bI&0 endif endif eval i %i% - 1 done elseif %person.quest_stage[banish]% == 2 quest advance banish %person.name% msend %person% &5&bA single letter pops into your mind - &6&bI&0 endif

triggers.name: banish_eidolon_death
triggers.commands: set person %actor% set i %actor.group_size% if %i% unset person while %i% > 0 set person %actor.group_member[%i%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[banish]% == 4 quest advance banish %person.name% msend %person% &5&bA single letter pops into your mind - &6&bU&0 endif endif eval i %i% - 1 done elseif %person.quest_stage[banish]% == 4 quest advance banish %person.name% msend %person% &5&bA single letter pops into your mind - &6&bU&0 endif

triggers.name: banish_seraph_death
triggers.commands: set person %actor% set i %actor.group_size% if %i% unset person while %i% > 0 set person %actor.group_member[%i%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[banish]% == 6 quest advance banish %person.name% msend %person% &5&bA single letter pops into your mind - &6&bP&0 endif endif eval i %i% - 1 done elseif %person.quest_stage[banish]% == 6 quest advance banish %person.name% msend %person% &5&bA single letter pops into your mind - &6&bP&0 endif

triggers.name: banish_murgbol_speech2
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[banish]% == 7 msend %actor% %self.name% chants along with you. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% chants along with %actor.name%. mecho %self.name% starts casting, &3&b'Vibugp'&0... wait 2s msend %actor% There is a bright flash as you feel the power of the spell well up in the words, &1&b'I banish thee!'&0 mskillset %actor.name% banish wait 1s msend %actor% &1&bYou have mastered the prayer for Banish!&0 quest complete banish %actor.name% if !%actor.quest_variable[hell_trident:helltask5]% && %actor.quest_stage[hell_trident]% == 1 quest variable hell_trident %actor% helltask5 1 endif mechoaround %actor% There is a bright flash as the spell goes off! mechoaround %actor% %actor.name% seems to be more connected to the universe! endif

triggers.name: banish_murgbol_status_checker
triggers.commands: wait 2 set stage %actor.quest_stage[banish]% if %actor.has_completed[banish]% say I have tought you all I can. halt elseif %stage% == 0 say I'm not teaching you right now... elseif %stage% switch %stage% case 1 set mob 41119 set place her chamber under the ocean waves set known Nothing. break case 2 set mob 53313 set place the frozen tunnels of the north set known v break case 3 set mob 37000 set place a deep and ancient mine set known vi break case 4 set mob 48005 set place a room filled with art in an ancient barrow set known vib break case 5 set mob 53417 set place the cold valley of the far north set known vibu break case 6 set mob 23811 set place a nearby fortress of clouds and crystals set known vibug break case 7 mecho %self.name% says, 'Come, speak the prayer aloud: &5&bvibugp&0!' halt break default return 0 done mecho %self.name% says, 'To learn Banish you must next:' mecho - kill %get.mob_shortdesc[%mob%]% in %place%. mecho mecho &0Your knowledge of the prayer so far: "&6&b%known%&0" endif

triggers.name: mesmeriz_death_banish
triggers.commands: set person %actor% set i %actor.group_size% if %i% unset person while %i% > 0 set person %actor.group_member[%i%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[banish]% == 3 quest advance banish %person.name% msend %person% &5&bA single letter pops into your mind - &6&bB&0 endif endif eval i %i% - 1 done elseif %person.quest_stage[banish]% == 3 quest advance banish %person.name% msend %person% &5&bA single letter pops into your mind - &6&bB&0 endif

triggers.name: Banish death trigger
triggers.commands: switch %self.vnum% case 41119 * Sea Witch set stage 1 set letter V break case 53313 * Ice Lord set stage 2 set letter I break case 37000 * Mesmeriz set stage 3 set letter B break case 48005 * Eidolon set stage 4 set letter U break case 53417 * Chaos Demon set stage 5 set letter G break case 23811 * lesser seraph set stage 6 set letter P done set person %actor% set i %actor.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif unset person while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[banish]% == %stage% quest advance banish %person.name% quest variable banish %person% greet 0 msend %person% &5&bA single letter pops into your mind - &6&b%letter%&0 endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done

rooms.name: Spur
rooms.description: A grassy spur shoots off the hillside to the south.  It is thick with lodgepole pines, whose regular trunks rise some distance above the ground before sprouting branches.  There is an attractive view of the forest to the northwest.  A tall peak to the southeast rises high into the clouds.

rooms.name: Rolling Road
rooms.description: A dusty road sweeps along the rolling hills.  It meets with a north-south road a small distance to the west.  To the east, it curves south through the golden grass.  The scent of the sea is light here, often difficult to smell. The road is well-traveled with the bootprints of soldiers and the tracks of cart wheels criscrossing the dust underfoot.

extras.text: Several cart tracks crisscross the dust, but the overwhelming majority of visible traffic appears to be booted individuals.  They cover the road and lead in both directions.

rooms.name: Rolling Road
rooms.description: Dust rises easily from the worn surface of this road.  It curves gently to follow the path of least resistance through rolling hills covered with dry grass and small shrubs.  Rocky outcrops pierce the ground like shattered spear tips, thrust up by bored demons.  The road leads west toward the ocean and south to a distant forest, beyond which rise the Mountains of Pain.

extras.text: The mountains are far off in the distance to the southeast.  They are gray or black and topped with white.  Many high peaks are visible.  This road appears to be heading in the general direction of a low point, where there may be a pass.
The trees of the forest blend together, being so far away, but they are dark green and thick. A few orange or yellow patches stand out, which are probably trees in their fall colors.
The outcrops are dry and flaky stone. They are a bit weathered but jagged. Yellow, orange, and gray lichens cover their surfaces like spatter from a bored painter.

rooms.name: Rolling Road
rooms.description: This increasingly rocky road is covered with the yellowish-brown dust exposed by hooves and boots.  Jagged rocks of dark gray, covered with orange lichens, jut from the earth at rakish angles.  The dry grass is interrupted by hardy oaks who make their living in these dry lands.  The road is going generally southeast from the coast, and here leads north and east.

extras.text: They are medium-sized, with dry light-gray bark and blueish-green leaves. They look as though they use less water than a kangaroo rat.

rooms.name: Rolling Road
rooms.description: Splinterlike rocks pave the surface of this road, ground down and broken from the shattered boulders that poke up from below.  Dry grass clings to the earth, but scattered clumps of trees deny them the sunlight and drink the precious water from the earth below.  The road leads west away from the trees, or south where they grow in a deeper forest.

rooms.name: Rolling Road in the Forest Outskirts
rooms.description: This road runs north-south through the dry hilly land and the numerous oaks that grow in unruly clumps.  They are not thick enough to be called a forest here, but to the south they are tall and rule the landscape.  Dry, rolling hills lie to the north.  Bootprints and wheel tracks cover the dust underfoot.

extras.text: The tracks are too many to make much out, overlapping and intermingling as they do. It is obvious that many boot-shod persons use this road, along with horses and wheeled vehicles.

rooms.name: Forest Road
rooms.description: This appears to be the edge of a forest.  A road passes north through the trees toward a hilly plain, and east into the heart of the woods.  The trees are not so tall here, so a small glimpse of the snowy Mountains of Pain is just visible, far to the southeast.  A small path leads through the trees to the south.

rooms.name: Forest Road
rooms.description: Beeches and oaks tower overhead.  A small road runs east-west under their arching canopies.  The road is not in the best condition, but a horse-sized path is definitely clear and passable.  Quiet lies over the forest like air of anticipation, interrupted only by the quiet cheeping of unseen birds.

rooms.name: Forest Road
rooms.description: The road runs east-west through this dark and quiet forest.  Though wide enough for a cart and horseman to pass easily, brambles and saplings are beginning to encroach from the sides.  There are signs that a single path along the road is being maintained, however.  Few sounds are heard.

extras.text: They look like recent growth, the oldest perhaps three years old. They are growing in the road, where a decent maintainer would not tolerate them. They have been cleared from a smaller pathway, however.

rooms.name: Forest Road
rooms.description: Darkness and silence sit in the air like unmoving smoke.  The thick foliage of aging oaks mutes all sound and blocks all sunlight from the road below. The road is partly overgrown, with creeping vines and hopeful saplings attempting to claim its land as their own.  The road leads east and west through the sullen woods.

rooms.name: Forest Road
rooms.description: The road here follows the rising hillside to the south.  Oaks and maples dominate the area, allowing little light to reach travelers.  The road also continues east into the gloom.  Though the mighty trees give the road a wide berth, it is much narrower than their distance would imply.

rooms.name: Hillside Road
rooms.description: A glimpse of mountains to the south identifies this as a foothill, a minor participant in a mightier mountain range.  A road meanders downward to the north, and passes among the stately trees as it rises to the south.  Pines and fir trees grow among the oaks, and an occasional maple shows a few reddish-yellow leaves.

extras.text: They're rather attractive in their autumn plumage.

rooms.name: Bluebonnet Pass
rooms.description: Steep hills cluster here at the base of the Mountains of Pain.  A road cuts through them as best it can, swinging east for the hills or plunging north into a deciduous forest.  Pines and fir trees cover the hillsides.  The road itself, poorly maintained, takes quite a turn for the worse here.  Though there is definite evidence of traffic from the west, to the east, the road looks almost unused.

extras.text: The traffic on the road seems to turn south away from the main route. It is quite overgrown to the east.

rooms.name: Mountain Path
rooms.description: This little side path splits off from the main road for no apparent reason. It is far too narrow for a cart.  Indeed, it would be foolhardy to ride even a horse upon it.  It is mostly hidden by trees as it leads south, away from Bluebonnet Pass.

rooms.name: Mountain Path
rooms.description: The path runs along the base of the foothills and through a low valley. Tall, mildly twisted pines cover the hillsides.  The slope is mild, and the path seems to be following a dry creekbed which runs down from the east and curves north.

rooms.name: Mountain Path
rooms.description: The peaks of the Mountains of Pain rise directly to the southeast.  This path, barely visible on the rocky hillside, takes a steep turn upward to the south.  It follows a dry creekbed going west, downward.  A pine forest grows all around.

rooms.name: Steep Mountain Path
rooms.description: The side of a mountain looms to the south, dotted by determined trees.  A path enters from the north and leads to the bottom of a series of switchbacks that climb through the trees.  The ground is rocky and dry, and a cold wind blows in from the west.

rooms.name: Switchbacks
rooms.description: A light path climbs laboriously up a mountainside here in the Mountains of Pain.  The tall, regular trunks of lodgepole pines are beginning to supplant less hardy trees, and junipers cling to the hillside as well.  Yellow and orange streaks plunge down the face of the rock in places.

rooms.name: Switchbacks
rooms.description: Long, irregular sections of path meander up the hillside, avoiding cliffs and loose sections, and making their eventual way toward the top.  A high peak juts out from the mass of mountains to the southeast.  It is high above this spot, which is about halfway up.  The path flattens out to the south.

rooms.name: Mountain Path
rooms.description: This is a light path on the lower reaches of a tall mountain.  Its peak looms to the east, dominating the landscape.  The path runs north and east through the thinning trees, whose bent and twisted forms resemble hideous trolls or ogres, horribly deformed by the endless struggle to live in the harsh winds that scour the earth.  Snowdrifts lurk in the shadows, punctuating the mostly bare rock.

rooms.name: Mountain Path
rooms.description: This is the lower edge of a steep, rocky mountainside rising to the east. Cold winds barrel across the rock, whistling among the grotesque, distorted branches of a few foolhardy junipers.  A path from the west disappears briefly, as if unwilling to scale the mountain, but is again visible heading upward.

rooms.name: Steep Path
rooms.description: A tiny footpath scales the mountainside here.  It is visible only due to the occasional rock pile or recently chipped rock, for there is little earth to support the low, hardy plants that eke out a living here.  No trees cling to life here.  Loose stones and snow-packed ravines make climbing hazardous.

rooms.name: Mountaintop Path
rooms.description: This is the western face of a tall peak in the Mountains of Pain.  The summit is far above to the east, but the sheer face of the cracked rock is impossible to climb.  A path, intermittently marked, gingerly encircles the peak on a southward track.  It also plunges to the west.  A forest slumbers far below, and beyond that, the gray thread of the ocean is sandwiched between the distant horizon and the sky.

rooms.name: Mountaintop Path
rooms.description: This rocky path skirts the upper reaches of a tall mountain whose peak rises to the northeast.  Flat rocks are piled in markers that show the way: north, where the path descends, and east, where it seems level.  No living thing is visible among the slick black rocks and the drifts of hard-packed snow.

rooms.name: Lookout Post
rooms.description: A fairly flat ledge of stone sits here on the southern face of a mountain. It is high up, and no plants grow here due to the constant, bitterly cold wind. Native rock has been piled around the edge of the wall to provide some shelter. Bits of trash litter the ground.  The mountainside seems passable to the west.

rooms.name: Bluebonnet Pass
rooms.description: Gently rolling hills merge with the forest floor.  The forest's mighty trees loom all around, allowing only rare glimpses of the steep mountains to the southeast.  The road appears to be rising as it approaches them.  Brambles and small trees are beginning to invade the roadway.

rooms.name: Bluebonnet Pass
rooms.description: The hills undulate beneath their prickly coat of pines.  An old cart road meanders along, diving through dry riverbeds and avoiding rocky outcroppings. The road rises steeply to the east as it approaches the mountains, and follows a gentle downward slope to the west.  It is poorly maintained.

rooms.name: Bluebonnet Pass
rooms.description: This is a high point in the western foothills of the Mountains of Pain.  An overgrown cart road proceeds east into the mountains here, and to the west it plunges down a steep, rocky hillside.  There, it disappears under the dark treetops of an oak forest that stretches nearly to the faraway ocean.

rooms.name: Bluebonnet Pass
rooms.description: A cold wind whistles through the sparse treetops of lodgepole pines, whose strangely regular trunks cover the mountainside.  This is a fairly flat area. A substantial peak rises some distance to the east, but the worn and overgrown road running through these trees avoids it, heading south.  It also leads west, going downhill.

rooms.name: Bluebonnet Pass
rooms.description: The steep rocky mountainside's occasional snowdrifts are interspersed with lone junipers, who cling to life in the thin, cold air.  A road skirts the rocky scree of a ridge to the northeast, leading north or east from this desolate spot.  A constant wind sucks the warmth out of everything.

rooms.name: Bluebonnet Pass
rooms.description: Deep in the Mountains of Pain, a few small thick-leaved plants cling to life among the windswept rocks.  The last of the trees grip the broken rock with gnarled roots, and none grow above this level.  Here and there, beds of stones and pebbles mark the path of a road leading up toward a nearby pass, or west along the edge of a massive pile of scree.

rooms.name: Bluebonnet Pass
rooms.description: The road runs along the top of a narrow ridge, diving on a westerly track as it comes as close as it will to a high peak that glowers down from the northeast.  The ridge runs south a bit on a path that avoids the highest elevations.  Only the hardiest of plants grow up here, and they lie flat to the rock where wind and goats must struggle to dislodge them.

rooms.name: Bluebonnet Pass
rooms.description: A pair of ridges cross here, forming an offset saddle over which the intrepit road passes.  There is a steep slope of about thirty feet where the road crosses from one side to the other.  Two peaks stand nearly equidistant, one to the northeast and one to the southwest, while the foothills fall away to either side.

rooms.name: Bluebonnet Pass
rooms.description: A knifelike ridge, running north and south, sits beside the road.  A nearby mountain rises to a peak just southwest of here, and a more distant one looms in the mist off to the northeast.  The road plunges to the south beside a cliff, but where it meets the sheer rock, small blue flowers cluster in the shelter.

rooms.name: Bluebonnet Pass
rooms.description: The sheer face of a cliff rises high to the southwest, and a cart road runs gingerly among the shattered rocks at its foot.  Little blue flowers grow in the shadow of the cliff, lining the roadway.  A few scraggly junipers cling to life on the windswept rock.  The road continues east.

rooms.name: Bluebonnet Pass
rooms.description: The road is interrupted by the trickling of a cold mountain creek.  It flows down off the mountainside to the north and through the scattered rock of the roadway.  Bits of rusted metal, splintered wood, and other debris poke up through the rocks.  The road runs east-west here through an undulation in the mountains.  A wide valley is visible in the distance to the east.

extras.text: The creek flows down off the hillside to the north, crosses the road, and continues south.  The water looks clear enough, but it is by no means clean, for bits of trash and debris lie in its bed.

Debris is scattered all around here.  It is composed of old nails, scraps of metal, rotten leather, and splintered boards.  There are also a couple of hilts or mace handles, now cracked.  Even a few bones are visible, some of them human.

rooms.name: Whitestone Creek
rooms.description: A tiny creek trickles through its stony bed and plunges over a precipice to the south.  In spite of its name, no white stones are visible.  As to the north, this area is littered with battle debris.  A high mountain looms overhead to the west, and a long low valley sits to the east, the silver ribbon of a faraway river running south to the ocean.

extras.text: The creek's clear water burbles as it runs over the broken stones and battle debris. There are definitely no white stones, however.
Broken pieces of armor armor and weapons lie scattered all about.  Many of them are barely visible beneath the broken rock; perhaps a more determined search would find something of value.

rooms.name: Bluebonnet Pass
rooms.description: The road tops a knee of rock covered with pine trees and heads west toward the snowy hilltops.  A steep section of the roadway leads downward at a dangerous angle.  A thin column of smoke rises far to the east beyond the regular treetops, but its source is invisible in the valley below.

rooms.name: Bluebonnet Pass
rooms.description: The road swerves west here, climbing a steep rocky hillside through the pines.  It enters from the south.  Oaks, maples, and beech trees grow thick down on the hillsides below.  A lazy breeze blows the cool air slowly through verdant treetops.  A barely visible side path splits off here, quickly disappearing in the trees to the north.

rooms.name: Mountain Path
rooms.description: This path creeps among the low foothills of the Mountains of Pain.  It approaches a mountain that towers directly to the northwest.  Though it is no great task to traverse this portion, the path evidently makes a long, arduous climb up ahead to the north along the side of the mountain.  Oak and pine trees intermingle here.

rooms.name: Mountain Path
rooms.description: A vertical cliff stands above this tiny path, blocking the way west.  On the other side, a thirty foot deep ravine descends slowly to the south.  The path angles upward to the north, and meanders south through rolling hills covered with oaks.  A wide valley seems to open up opposite the cliff, but it is difficult to see past the treetops.

rooms.name: Mountain Path
rooms.description: The mountainside to the west rises steeply, almost like the face of a cliff, while a deep chasm sits on the opposite side of the path.  A wide valley dotted with farms disappears into the distant haze to the northeast.  The path continues its tortured climb to the north, and descends rather abruptly to the south.

extras.text: Farmouses and barns lie in ruins, some burned, others simply knocked down. The fields are muddy and overgrown with weeds for the most part.  At least one field seems to be planted, however.

rooms.name: Mountain Path
rooms.description: The path climbs precariously up the side of the mountain.  Its peak towers out of sight in the thin clouds to the west.  Cracking rocks and loose stone make footing treacherous.  Gnarled pines grip the rock, braced against the constant wind.  Piles of scat betray the presence of small animals.

extras.text: Indeed, the small furry critters that scurry about feeding on hardy mountain grasses have left unmistakable evidence of their digestive processes.

rooms.name: Mountain Path
rooms.description: Only a few stunted trees grow wedged in the deepest cracks of this high mountainside.  The top of the mountain is far above, out of sight in the clouds to the west.  The path makes a steep descent to the south, and continues along a broken crag to the north.  A farmed valley lies far below to the east.

extras.text: The valley is bisected by a shimmering river that flows in from the northeast. It is dotted with farmhouses.  The extents of each field are visible, though to the trained eye it is clear that few crops now grow.  It is hard to tell from this great distance, but it appears that many of the farmhouses lie in ruins.

rooms.name: Mountain Path
rooms.description: Broken black rock litters the ground on this cold, damp mountain.  Cold winds whip past.  A sharp curve in the path nestles in an indentation in the mountainside.  The path descends normally to the south, but rises up the steep rock of the mountain here for quite some distance.

rooms.name: Switchbacks
rooms.description: Freezing gales threaten to scour the mountainside clean.  Only the tiniest of plants grow in sheltered cracks here on the northeast face of a mountain, whose peak still towers out of sight.  The path gropes back and forth on the solid rock, occasionally requiring a terrifying leap from one crack to the next.  The Mountains of Pain lie below.

rooms.name: Switchbacks
rooms.description: A set of tortuous switchbacks from below comes to an end here, and a path that is merely steep continues west.  A mountain peak is barely visible in the drifting clouds to the southwest.  The Mountains of Pain seem to go on forever in every direction, their dark crags glowering under a cool gray haze.

rooms.name: Lookout
rooms.description: A slightly sheltered clearing sits on the shoulder of a mountain to the south.  Large boulders cluster around the edge, some apparently moved there to block the freezing winds.  Bits of trash and burned wood collect in crevices in the stone.  There is a stunning view of the valley to the west, and sharp eyes can make out long sections of the road far below.  A footpath descends to the east.

rooms.name: Bluebonnet Pass
rooms.description: The road carefully follows the curves of the foothills, with the Mountains of Pain rising high in the air to the northwest.  Oak and maple trees grow in profusion, providing welcome shade.  The road leads east, where some clearcutting is apparent, and north upward into the hills.

rooms.name: Westroad
rooms.description: A clearcut area begins here and continues east.  No tree has been spared whatever appetite consumes this forest.  An encampment of some sort occupies the farmland off to the west, and a village sits beyond that, smoking.  The road leads toward the mountains to the northwest, and may be followed west or south.

rooms.name: Westroad
rooms.description: Stumps cover the ground, but the living forest can be seen off to the west, just below the rising foothills of the Mountains of Pain.  A cart road runs through the remains of the trees leading north and east.  The air is scented with unclean smoke that seems to drift in from the east, but from the ground, not from the column of smoke above the village.

rooms.name: High in the Air
rooms.description: The nearby ledge is regrettably out of reach, and you are high up in the air with nothing to support you!  A distant gray valley lies far below, ready to meet you in a cold embrace.

rooms.name: High in the Air
rooms.description: Ravine walls stand far out of reach.  The clammy mountain air swirls and dances through a narrow valley, creating chilly vortices that play with your clothing.  Light mists hang in the air in much the same way that adventurers don't.

rooms.name: Above a Ravine
rooms.description: Jagged rocks cluster below at the foot of this ravine's steep walls.  They are gray and lifeless, though not without malice for unwary adventurers.  The chill in the air bites deep, and it is laden with mist and misery.

rooms.name: A Narrow Ravine
rooms.description: Jagged boulders and sharp gray rocks cluster at the bottom of two sheer cliff faces, which form a ravine that descends to the north.  Water trickles below the boulders, but it is a small flow that makes only subdued noise.  The only other sound is that of the howling wind, which barrels through the valley like a stagecoach hunted by werewolves.

extras.text: The boulders are huge and jagged.  They look like the kind of scree that might collect in the bottom of a ravine below steep rocky ridges.  There are innumerable crevices and hiding places among them.  Is that a board sticking out from under one?
Speaking of stagecoaches, it looks as though one may have crashed here. Closer examination reveals the hub of a wheel - with broken spokes - and a bleached bones, which seem to have come from horses.
The wreckage of the stagecoach looks rather worthless, actually.

rooms.name: High in the Air
rooms.description: The nearby ledge is regrettably out of reach, and you are high up in the air with nothing to support you!  A distant gray valley lies far below, ready to meet you in a cold embrace.

rooms.name: High in the Air
rooms.description: The rocky wall to the west stands far out of reach.  The clammy mountain air swirls and dances through a narrow valley, creating chilly vortices that play with your clothing.  Light mists hang in the air in much the same way that adventurers don't.

rooms.name: Above a Cluster of Boulders
rooms.description: Large boulders lie heaped about on the hillside below.  They are gray and lifeless, though not without malice for unwary adventurers.  The chill in the air bites deep, and it is laden with mist and misery.

rooms.name: A Stony Cul-De-Sac
rooms.description: Mounds of boulders surround this small flattened area at the base of a mountain.  Trees grow through them as best they can.  It is difficult to see the surrounding countryside, except the tall peaks of the Mountains of Pain to the west.  A small path leads upward.

rooms.name: A Snowy Crevasse
rooms.description: A crack jogs up the side of a mountain.  It somewhat protected on the west side by a shoulder of rock whose top is about as high as the top of an orc's head.  Further down, it swerves to the west, while up ahead to the north, it narrows down to nothing and disappears.

rooms.name: A Snowy Lair
rooms.description: This is a cave, dug in the stiff snow high in the mountains.  A tiny hole in the south allows the wan sunlight in.  It appears that the denizens of this cave have brought back any odd rock, feather, or ice crystal that catches their fancy, and made a pile of baubles.  Other than that, it's fairly tidy here.

extras.text: Somehow, whoever gathered these items has managed to miss anything of value. Colored stones and broken wishbones are piled high among pretty maple leaves. Not even a scrap of leather awaits the enterprising looter.

rooms.name: Mountainside
rooms.description: The sheer side of the mountain rises up like the face of a cliff.  There are few footholds.  Bits of ice sit in every crack, ready to dislodge your grip. The thin, cold air whips by mercilessly, draining away body heat and bringing tears to exposed eyes.  Luckily, the peak is not far above.

rooms.name: Mountain Peak
rooms.description: This is the highest point for many miles in any direction.  From here, Bluebonnet Pass is clearly visible to the northeast.  A sentry post lies down below to the south, on the side of this very mountain.  Low clouds obscure much of the ground in valleys on either side of the range, but the orc armies and the smoking ruins of Tyllwedd can be seen to the east, while the orderly structures of Sacred Haven lie nestled in the forest to the west.
